collection_holder_name: Special Collections, D. Hiden Ramsey Library
pageContext.collection_description: Julian Price was a businessman, journalist, and civic leader. A native of Greensboro, NC, Price was the grandson of Jefferson Standard Insurance executive Julian Price (1867-1946). Price lived in Asheville, NC, from 1990 until his death in 2001, using his extensive wealth and philanthropic spirit to fuel a revitalization of Asheville’s downtown. Price was very interested in radio and print journalism, and recorded a number of interviews for broadcast on public radio stations. This collection contains over 50 cassette recordings of Price’s radio programs.
collectionFormats: Optical disc (Including CD, CD-R, CD-RW, DVD, DVD-R, DVD-RW, VCD)
pageContext.collection_notes: The finding aid lists dates of radio interviews when known. Otherwise the interviews are noted as undated.
pageContext.collection_usage_statement: Permission required from Special Collections, UNC Asheville, to duplicate or publish any material from interviews.
